Articles.Content:
Quick question: I've built a rover, but the controls are reversed, so that W drives backwards and S drives forwards. I've tried rearranging the wheels to no avail, and selecting "Invert Steering" on the wheels only seems to apply to turns. What should I to make it recognize the intended front of the vehicle?

Edited July 10, 2013 by Kimberly
Easy, you've got your probe core upside down. (Happens to me fairly regular.)
Try rotating your command pod 180 degrees, that should make w or whatever you mapped it to go forward ect.
I was also puzzled over this. This explains a lot. Thanks.
That's odd, that would mean the large logo on the probe core would be point towards the back...kind of unintuitive. Oh well, thanks for the quick response!
The easiest solution I found to this was to add a dockingport jr. to the front of my rovers and controlling from there, it even flips the navball in the correct orientation.
I have an idea, similar to control surfaces, could it depend on the center of mass? (doubt it, but worth a try) nevermind the question has been answered!
